nodes.bodyText: I'd prefer if this were called bucketSpaceOf, as "bucket space" to "bucket" is a bit like "table" is to "tablet" in e.g. BigTable, i.e. on different levels of abstraction. Consider also renaming other variables to match.
This should not be logged as warning
Consider throwing an exception (assuming this is an unexpected behaviour).
Are we leaking Guava types from our curator framework? 🤦
Consider adding debug-logging when this happens
Catching these might not even work if bundles disagree on the class instance

commit.message: Address review comments, and fix unit test

nodes.bodyText: I presume this is a synchronous write to ZooKeeper? If it's observed to be a performance issue, it could be useful to consider making progress updates async since this is called in the context of a visitor client worker thread callback.

Could we ever get a case where multiple (disparate) reindexing controller clusters run against the same ZooKeeper cluster? I don't really see this happening with our current setup, mind you. We could probably use some ZK chroot-style magic if we need to support it.
For those of us not too familiar with these newfangled and fancy Phaser doohickies, a comment on how this ends up transitively aborting the active visitor session would be nice 🦖
